description.narrative: By 2020, the Ministries in charge of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, as well as the local authorities of the target regions, have enhanced capacities for coordination, planning and monitoring including in case of emergency.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the Ministries in charge of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, as well as the local authorities of the target regions, have enhanced capacities for coordination, planning and monitoring including in case of emergency.

description.narrative: In 2019, the Country Office supported the development of the country-led monitoring system, which uses the evaluation and monitoring integrated system (EMIS) platform for the routine M&E of drinking water. The monitoring system has been adopted by water supply sub-sector actors, the Ministry of Plan and technical and financial partners. Due to the recurrence of floods and in alignment with the inter-agency contingency plan, UNICEF WASH supplies were pre-positioned to cover the needs of 3,000 households in case of emergency. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:09/02/2020
